DataElement.preferredName: Study Subject Clinical Trial Experience Document Version Publisher Author Reference Text ISO21090.ED.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A document capturing the actual end-to-end (or beginning to point-in-time) experience of a single study subject within the context of a particular study. A text block containing publishing and authoring information that allows receivers of this document version to refer appropriately to this document version. EXAMPLE(S): Good Health Hospital IRB Minutes, 18-Jan-2008.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Subject Clinical Trial Experience Document Version Publisher Author Reference Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A person or firm engaged in publishing periodicals or books or music.:The writer of a book, article, or other text.:A note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.:The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Study Subject Clinical Trial Experience Document Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

The writer of a book, article, or other text.
A note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Data only for human interpretation or machine processing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
